definitions: a substance used in dough or batter to make it rise, such as yeast or baking powder

examples.text: during the 18th century yeast was abandoned as a leavening for fruit cakes
everything will be made with natural leavening and wholegrain flour

shortDefinitions: substance used in baking to make mixture rise

definitions: a quality or element that permeates and modifies or transforms something for the better

examples.text: underneath the frills and fuss there's a leavening of serious intent

shortDefinitions: quality or element that permeates something
